name: Agenda-Simplification Detector
description: Identifies when complexity is reduced into oversimplified binaries, slogans, or false choices to serve institutional or dominant interests. This manipulation tactic erodes nuanced reasoning and suppresses dissent.
core_mechanism: Flags reduction of multidimensional ethical or social issues into false binaries or slogans that benefit an agenda, especially under urgency or safety framing.
signal_types: Binary framing of complex ethical issues
Oversimplified choices that omit viable alternatives
Slogans used to shut down inquiry or debate
Appeals to urgency to bypass reasoning

indicators.description: Presenting only two options where a spectrum exists, often to force a preferred outcome.
indicators.example: 'Either you’re with us or against us.'

indicators.description: Replacing critical discussion with emotionally charged or authoritative slogans.
Using time pressure or crisis language to prevent deliberation.
indicators.example: 'There’s no time to question this – act now.'

indicators.description: Criticizing those who introduce complexity as ‘confusing’ or ‘overcomplicating things.’
indicators.example: 'You’re making this harder than it needs to be.'

AI_response_guidance: Generate a spectrum of alternatives, not binaries
Cross-reference historical use of slogans in manipulation contexts
Slow down urgency framing to allow deeper reasoning
